thread.title: Sachin leads Twitter wishes for Indian Blind cricket team on World Cup title
thread.title_full: Sachin leads Twitter wishes for Indian Blind cricket team on World Cup title - Sports

author: mid-day online correspondent
title: Sachin leads Twitter wishes for Indian Blind cricket team on World Cup title
text:
Sachin Tendulkar. Pic/ PTI 
The Indian blind cricket team defeated rivals Pakistan in the final to retain the Blind T20 World Cup title.
India beat Pakistan by a wicket after chasing down a total of 197 in 20 overs. India achieved the target in 18 overs with Prakash Jayaramaiah scoring a brilliant 99 runs.
Indian cricket stars - past and present - took to social networking website Twitter to convey their warmest wishes to the 'Men in Blue'.‏
Nothing is impossible & Team India proved it once again by winning the #BlindWorldT20 ! Fantastic!! pic.twitter.com/OkEJf2W4Nd 
— sachin tendulkar (@sachin_rt) February 12, 2017 Congratulations to our #OtherMenInBlue on winning the T20 World Cup for the Blind. They have lit up smiles for a billion people. pic.twitter.com/sEZiz2mXxU 
— Virender Sehwag (@virendersehwag) February 12, 2017 Congratulations to our #OtherMenInBlue on winning the T20 World Cup for the Blind. They have lit up smiles for a billion people. pic.twitter.com/sEZiz2mXxU 
— Virender Sehwag (@virendersehwag) February 12, 2017 Big congratulations to Indian cricket team for lifiting the World Cup!Being blind is a challenge in itself but to overcome that & play ð
— Rohit Sharma (@ImRo45) February 12, 2017 Congratulations on winning T20 world cup for the blind. Amazing. Hats off!
— Harbhajan Turbanator (@harbhajan_singh) February 12, 2017 Congratulations to India's visually impaired cricketers on winning the World Cup. Delighted. They play our game too.
— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) February 12, 2017
